Newton and Yeh and Dr. Schattner for emphasizing the need to further understand the relationship between influenza virus infection and acute cardiovascular events. In our analysis based on ICD codes, 4412 patients hospitalized with laboratory-confirmed influenza had acute IHD. Among these, 4.6% had ST-segment elevation MI, 43.6% had non–ST-segment elevation MI, 12% had acute MI without specification of the presence of ST-segment elevation, and 38.4% had other acute IHD not otherwise specified; only 1.4% of patients had unstable angina as the only evidence of acute IHD.
